overview_of_class: This course will consider, from both a theoretical and experiential perspective, the meaning of movement awareness using theories and approaches from various movement theorists.  These theorists include Moshe Feldenkrais, Rudolf Laban, Irmgard Bartenieff, and Joseph Pilates.  The following will be considered: self-awareness through movement, and the influence on movement education; movement awareness for the function of muscular strength and flexibility; movement awareness in relation to dynamic qualities, body part organizations, use of effort and use of space.  Students will be asked to integrate theories and experiences in a practical demonstration as a dance performer, a dance choreographer, OR a dance teacher.
name: Introduction to the Dance Experience
subject: DANCE
